description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 8 years
pros: some of the people. nice view from the office
cons: management, lack of direction, protective culture of management
advice: no point they don't listen

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros:
The workload is fairly easy and manageable
depending on where you work it is flexible hours
they pay for travel if you do overtime 
great for getting your feet wet in finance
you learn about all aspects of the business and it is really hands on
cons:
Commision structure
Too much requirement for understanding things
advice: Create a better culture for learning and understanding

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: None - worst mistake I made job wise
cons: Awful place to work, very low salaries yet they expect you to work anti social hours and most of the time on your own.  Never hear from senior management, CEO is non existent and never visits stores.  All senior manager are mates of mates - it’s a boys club!
advice: Get some professional senior management who know how to communicate and follow through actions

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: If they didn’t work so well with my schedule, I would’ve left them by now.
cons: They don’t appreciate their employees. It’s like even if you do good, they expect more and it’s never enough for them.
advice: Instead of putting down your employees, tell them their doing a good job and to keep up the good work.

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than 5 years
pros: You are trapped their for ever no job prosperous
cons: Not good for job prosperous.You are doing the same job again and again
advice: Please listen to your employees

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time
pros: Straight forward work, allows for commission opportunity, flexible hours for workers that are also attending college
cons: One mistake and you get a warning easily. Minimum wage pay for a lot of responsibilities.
advice: Has to understand workers have a life outside of work. More pay should be given for all the things they expect you to do.

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than 3 years
pros:
You make very close friends given only 3-5 work in the same bureau
It's a very relaxed atmosphere
Management are very respectful and easy to reach
cons: Procedures change very regularly and sometimes there is confusion as to which is most recent and sometimes even HR don't know! It can be confusing
advice: Keep everything updated when possible and pass this down the chain as soon as changes are made

description: I worked at Travelex part-time for less than a year
pros: You are essentially your own manager and work alone most of the time. Foreign currency itself can be interesting.
cons: Most customers are very unhappy about our rates, and any foreign customer who wants to exchange their country's currency will be disappointed. The rates are terrible, and any foreign clients feel ripped off and vulnerable. In the San Francisco region many employees have been their for decades. They will "instruct" you to be manipulative and oversell a customer what they need. Prepare to be constantly...
advice: My manager was unresponsive (phone calls, emails) and doesn't seem to care very much about employees. In the part time employment contract, it stated there would be a minimum of 20 hours; I was only given 4 hours a week and only started another 8 hour shift because some gave it to me. From the get go this company was dishonest, so it's no surprise the sales techniques are too. Many systems (IT, payroll) are based...

description: I worked at Travelex  for more than a year
pros: Working alone, not crazily KPI driven, good rate when purchasing cash
cons: Low wage, no management support, no room for career progression, unrealistic KPI targets
advice: Increase pay, create the opportunity to have career progression

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros:
dont need much skills to get in.
Maryanne - Loyd - the area manager for Terminal 5. An amazing manager to work under given the circumstances and pressures we are put under. She genuinely cares.
cons: this is an awful job, the only ones who are doing this full time is lack of opportunity any where else. i suggest if you end up here, it will be very difficult to leave so study and learn a trade on your days off.
advice: grow up- you aernt making more than 20k so dont get on a power trip.

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than 3 years
pros: Relatively flexible working hours. Very few parts of the job are really difficult.
cons: Everything else. Wages are not conducive to the amount of responsibility undertaken. Training is often minimal and given by colleagues (who aren't paid extra to train you) rather than specialist trainers. While the hours aren't long, the job is emotionally and mentally draining, and can be extremely stressful when dealing with difficult customers, or how a momentary lapse can cost you hundreds of pounds. The...
advice: Look at the management culture in the company, which seems to reward brashness and overconfidence over actual competence. Overhaul training, and make wages more in line with the responsibility involved; these things may address the disillusionment and indifference amongst many staff, and the high turnover of staff.

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: Some nice people, free parking
cons: Bullied by line management, constant criticism by management to the point of being made  unwell, unrealistic workloads. Head office have no understanding of what happens outside of the Ivory Tower
advice: Consider better support for employees who suffer mental health issues. Senior management team should take action when concerns are raised about bullying.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros: Working in the airport, great people, meet new and interesting people, overtime available, depending on your perspective - shift work
cons: Can be low paying,  can become quiet if there are no customers
advice: increase bonus incentives

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: loads of overtime at certain times of the year (summer and covering annual leave) enjoy speaking to customers about where they are travelling
cons: not much progression, weekend working is not fairly distributed, lonely working hours sometimes not seeing a colleague a full shift, when someone is off sick for long periods the rest of the shop are expected to take on their hours
advice: Have a cover team (i understand this is difficult due to widespread locations) that are not based in certain shops but each week have shifts in shops covering staff illness and holidays. This is successful in past companies I have worked for.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros: Once you have a good team in place who know the job, you're kind of left to manage the bureau on your own. You very rarely get a visit of Regional Managment unless there is an issue or an annual review, having said that you are in regular contact via email/phone.
cons:
- Very lonely in quieter months
- Poor salary
- Poor career progression
- Lack of praise
advice: They're too often on a power trip, advice is very rarely taken onboard.

description: I worked at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros: The hours were flexible, late shift or early shift options.
cons: The management has favorites and best shifts are assigned to them
advice: avoid favoritism

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: Good for people who have no problem with remembering lots of figures and maths and remembering individual customers throughout the day
cons: Pay doesn't reflect your job role at all, I now get paid much more for a much easier job.  Small confined space, mistakes have little tolerance, have to enter your own hours.
advice: Better interview questions to see if you're fit for the job, pay increase for travel money advisors

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros: Great comrades, good training, plenty free time to add on to holidays. Possibility of monthly bonuses to make a more respectable income. Part time availability makes it possible to start up a home business.
cons: Long periods of inactivity can be extremely wearing - how long can you re-read the blogs on the company internal website?  Working at an airport can also be wearing in terms of sleep deprivation - 3 am starts can be an acquired taste!
advice: Generally the staff I have worked with are bright and intelligent so maybe the hierarchy could pay a little more attention to their requests. One example I have come across is the continual shortage of currency. There is no profit in running out of US dollars!

description: I worked at Travelex part-time
pros:
* Had a good line manager
* Small discount on currency
* Not a boring job
cons: Too much work to physically complete during work hours if you are based in a busy location and following all the procedures became difficult. Very stressful job.
advice: Hire more staff as staff can get very overworked

description: I worked at Travelex part-time
pros: Some customers were nice to talk to
cons:
Poor training procedures 
Expected to work an 11 hour shift with just 30 minutes unpaid break Isolating and uncomfortable work environment, constantly being watched on CCTV by three cameras in a kiosk the size of a phone box
Too much responsibility for little pay 
You have to wear an Asda uniform although you don't work for Asda and don't receive their perks 
Overcomplicated and time consuming paperwork 
Little...
advice:
Improve your training procedures
Consider changing the work environment
Simplify your way of working

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros:
Not too demanding and very little stress
If you take initiative you can have an impact
Nice atmosphere if a little boring
Relaxed and more of a small company culture
cons:
Moves at insanely slow pace
Opportunities based more on knowing the right people, than output
Retains under performing staff for years
Continous escalation of decision making to higher up the chain, as no one whats to take responsibility
advice:
Under performing staff need to be held accountable, as has negative impact on good performers over time. 
Trust your good performs more and empower them to make decisions.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 5 years
pros: Higher duty allowance and shift penalty. My Manager at the time was running a 3 man job on her own, she was awesome.
cons: Too much responsibility/pressure pushed onto staff that were underpaid and overworked. Staff turnover was horrendous.
advice: Hire more staff! More recognition and/or incentive for the staff that show initiative and high achievers.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: As of all its a dream to work in a airport with a good passion
cons: Friends and very professional
advice: No

description: I worked at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros:
Easy work when you’re trained and can work fast, can just spend your spare time sat on computer doing whatever you like. 

Working alone was great at times when you’re not in the mood for talking. 

Great sense of responsibility handling such large amounts of money.
cons:
This really depends on your immediate manager and how they plan shifts. My manager chose to put me on the weekend shifts every week for months and no matter how many times I asked to change this and accommodate my hours so I worked in the week sometimes instead, this never happened. 

If staff leave/go on sick in my experience as they weren’t quick to recruit new staff, this workload is all put on you.

Nature of...
advice: Area managers should take a closer look at shift patterns and see whether managers and other employees are doing their fair share of unsociable hours. Also should recruit as soon as employees go on sick rather than leaving this problem to develop and then putting all that work on one employee.

description: I worked at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros: Lots of down time during slow months, easy work, meeting different people in the airport, learning about different currencies and cultures was pretty cool as well
cons: Only a few full time positions. That’s really all I have to say. It was a great company to work.
advice: Stay awesome!

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros:
Working 3 on 3 off and having long holidays.
Having sick pay.
cons: 7.50 an hour to work 10hours 15 minutes then 45 minute break so a long day, rude customers, useless staff not able to do the job as the company employs anyone, depressing job sat in a box all day being watched by cctv not aloud to use your phone and the computers are restricted to work use, managers thing that you belong there with no respect only earn 14000 a year waste of time of bonuses. No progression and if so...
advice: Pay the employees more and give them Better benefits and bonuses.

description: I worked at Travelex  for more than 3 years
pros: I got to work with different currencies and met people from various parts of the world. The Airport is always busy which was good for me.
cons:
Incompetent front line management team. Most of the managers were promoted due to favoritism and ability to talk the talk. And even after the promotion, they are only given operational training and no management training. 
Zero regards for staff welfare and only interested in making sales.
Always short of staff but when the Corporate management member or associates are flying through the terminal there will be a...
advice:
Need to have a proper interview process and not just take anyone that applies. A girl was promoted to a manager position and it was her first ever job.
Introduce a management team induction process.
Focus on staff welfare, staffing levels, disciplinary actions and better pay package.
I know this will not change anyways

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time
pros: Decent salary for entry level, bonus is relatively easy to get at peak times (Summer/Winter/Easter). Staff are great and culture of working is good. Working 3 on 3 off is good as you end up working for only half the year. Loads of overtime.
cons: Rude customers. Little option for progression. Understaffed at times, can get quite stressful if it gets busy and you have no team members with you.
advice: Pay your staff better if they have more experience.

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time
pros: Good hours, good work/life balance, ok heathcare, decent paid vacation time.
cons: Low pay compared to rest of industry, no rollover on sick time or vacation time, don't always pay your earned bonuses without having to fight for it. Very poor IT dept makes for computer problems at times. They offer a decent, 401k plan, but due to low pay you can't afford to contribute anything to it.
advice: Pay needs to increase if you want to keep good employees, and if you promise bonuses, you need to follow through.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: The only good thing about travelex is there online ordering as people actually get decent rates
cons: I worked for travelex for 8 months, I would do 10/12 hours a day and would only serve 3-6 customers in 1 day the rates are so low that no one wants to buy there and then.. I was working on my own and did 6 days straight for 2 and a bit months with no time for myself. You have nothing else to do but to watch the clock untill close as it was so dead. I'm happy I don't work there anymore didn't even get a thank you for...
advice: Treat staff well

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for less than a year
pros: It is a multinational company and the company itself does try to provide best customer experiences around the world. They do provide training and certifications.
cons: Management in Australia really needs to work up. Training provided is not up to the par and customer service is not the best in industry. Moreover, working for Travelex doesn't make you feel pride as there is a sense of no connection to the company as a whole. Every sales consultant is working on their own in their stores and rarely know other people in the company.  Pay level is often not justified with the stress...
advice: Management need to spend more on Marketing and Human Resource. Pay rates need to be increased or more hiring should be done to reduce responsibilities on the individuals.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: Learning about currency and rates.
cons:
-you will never revive a pay increase 
-the manager in the La region is disrespectful and will belittle you every chance she gets. 
-management will try to make you quit before firing you 
-they do outside hires for management 
-a lot of harassment from management 
-will warn you not to call HR on them because they know they are being unethical.
advice: Do proper research on the people you take on as managers and consider promoting employees to manager positions instead of having outside hires.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: To be honest, there wasn't much positive about this job.
cons: Long Shifts, often working in a small booth completely alone for 10 hours.
advice: Have 2 people working together at all times.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Good for part time work, weekends etc
cons: I worked at Travelex little over 3 years. I dont see anyone sticking to travelex unless they have no other option in life. The managment is run by clowns, working hard to hit KPIs is a must, and for the salary you  are being paid, its not worth the effort. High staff turnover as most people wont be able to cope and keep the hard work for such little reward and zero career progression. The back biting is constant...
advice: appreciate and be supportive to staff. dont treat all of them like a number.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: You get to work independently most of the time. The manager would visit once a week. Full time benefits are great. They will match on 401K contributions. Medical, Dental, Vision are very affordable. Holiday pay is great for Full timers.
cons: They have done away with hiring full time employees because they do not want to pay out the money for benefits.  The exchange rates are very high. 20% above the market rate plus service charge. You are working alone and do not get any support with IT.  YOU ARE IT!!! If you work in a kiosk you will be in a cold and loud environment. They will want you to quit before they fire you so they can save money and not pay...
advice: Get your stuff straight.  Hire people who know how to treat employees.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Busy customer facing role.
cons: Doesn't suitable for working parent.
advice: Treat your employee as asset not liability.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: okay hours and okay pay.
cons: boring, no help when needed, unorganised, no room for progression. NONE.
advice: be more organised.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: Most of the colleagues are nice and helpful as they are also new to Travelex. The system is user friendly and easy to learn.
cons: Some of the staff who have been working for long time thinks they own Travelex and not welcoming at all as they are on old contract which was good pay. Salary is minimum wage but the targets you have to meet is unbelievable so a lot of pressure for what you get paid.
advice: I am sure management can have a meeting with higher up and explain the situation that new employees are joining and leaving due to the pay. But management does not realize that they are losing more money by wasting money on recruitment and training.

description: I worked at Travelex  for more than a year
pros: An okay job if you don't mind working alone and feel you can grasp all aspects of the role. You have to be methodical and be capable of using your initiative because there's a significant chance you'll have no one to ask for help.
cons:
Can be lonely on your own, especially when busy and you have a queue of people waiting and you're dealing with large wads of cash. 
Management tend to hire anyone in order to have people to cover shifts - they're usually not the ones training them so why do they need to worry! Training incompetent people was the final nail in it for me. 
I was hired for 20 hours but ended up working full time because we never had...
advice: Check in with your team members every now and again. A quick phone call to make sure they're okay can do the world of good.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: Good training Good technology. Good brand values
cons: Rates of Pay Getting holidays No breaks
advice: Roll out the training modules better

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros: all bureaus work together .. Additional work available to cover other bureaus
cons: Basic hourly rate not that good considering the volume of monies that are handled and pressures the job brings
advice: Interact with non managers more

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros:
People are around you are friendly 
Free parking
cons:
Small outdated screens
Unapproachable management 
Awful pay
No career progression 
 You are given extra training to take twice as many calls without any choice but do not get any extra pay, for extra pay you have to be ‘multi skilled’ but it’s impossible to become their definition of multi skilled. They expect you to type up your call notes while your on your call, if you come out of available for a second to...
advice: Review your pay, if you take more than one set of calls give your staff more money. Get new screens it’s not the 80’s. Treat your staff better, office in Kings Place gets Pizza Fridays and alcohol for free, Peterborough Office gets nothing but stress.

description: I worked at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros: Excellent if the teams good. Easy Job and Decent pay. Great location. Would definitely recommend to any applying as part-time and not a career choice
cons: Can be tedious for some and it also can be lonely.All depends on the team. They are kind of a stickler about sales and customer service but more so sales over all.
advice: Care about the staff members

description: I worked at Travelex part-time for more than 3 years
pros: Supportive colleagues and suitable shifts
cons: There is no time and space to describe all of the cons. No empathy towards employees. No career progression. Stress is a daily routine. At the end if there is a possibility every pound honestly earned will be cut without excuse. I would never ever recommend a company that has no interest in employees.  I don’t even spend a penny on a product that comes out from business that has no healthy relationship towards...
advice: Educate your management

description: I worked at Travelex  for more than 3 years
pros: works with student schedules, lots of down time
cons: no room for growth, you will most likely stay in your position
advice: Needs more training

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros: No previous experience needed to start
cons: No possibilities of progression after years of working with the company.
advice: More people skills required instead of just focusing on the statistics.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros:
The people 
The opportunity to make an impact
The constant change
cons: None if you work hard and care about what you are there to do, you will succeed
advice: Nothing

description: I worked at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros:
A positive experience for entry into financial services. 

The opportunity to learn about currency and how it is obtained. 

Bonus for meeting monthly sales goals.
cons:
Many customers feel ripped off by industry practices - It can make you feel bad about yourself. 

Excessive time spent doing nothing. It becomes boring and shifts can go by slowly. 

Low pay for industry: 11.50 per hour is lackluster which may explain why they have difficulty attracting better customer service professionals.

Some shifts start as early as 5:30am.
advice: Increase hourly wage, expand products and/or benefits for the customer, stop scheduling employees too early, and foster more interaction between employees.

description: I worked at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros: Lots of downtime to read or do homework.  This is a good part time job for students who take going to school seriously.  Also good managers that help with time off and help you with making sales.
cons: The only cons is that sometimes you get rude customers and they try to haggle you on prices but where can you not find rude customers? You just have to get used to them.
advice: Keep doing what your doing!

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros: Great Culture and Growth opportunities
cons: Too focus on short term goals
advice: Think more of workers less on arbitrary goals

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time
pros: You are given a lot of responsibility on a small team, so you do get a lot of experience beyond what the job title states. Also, as far as work life balance, you can't beat it.
cons: Depending on offshore teams is tiring. UK management seems to be out of touch of North American realities.
advice: Take the time to learn what each member does. There are so many working parts to this machine and its hard to set expectations when you don't realize what people do or how they contribute.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Leaves you homeless bad wages no payries it's a waste of time working for  minimum the  ceiling links
cons: There is nothing called  equal opportunity
advice: No Consistent  Poor conditions

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: Great office with an in house barista. Generally a nice vibe around the place with many people being friendly and talkative across different business areas. Challenging work and ever changing work as the company continues to grow, move and adapt. The finance department tries to stay ahead.
cons: Sometimes not enough clear direction. Too much wasted work produced from general brainstorming. "lets prepare this and see if its useful", rather "lets work together to build something we know is necessary and develop in to a useful, timely report".
advice: No advice other than staying focused on producing work that is of value to the company and saving resources by not taking brainstorming sessions too far

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros:
Easy work and lots of downtime for small locations. Employees get discounts on currency that is almost same as the market rate. Lately, company has been coming up with new products and promotions which is making work more exciting.
Flexible work schedule.
cons:
The currency rates are really bad, which makes it harder to keep customers. I wish corporate would make the rates more competitive so we can have more sales. 
I see my manager maybe twice a year (not really a complaint though, I like the freedom). Can get a little boring at times.
advice: Lower the exchange rates to be more competitive!

description: I worked at Travelex  for less than a year
pros: BAU knowledge, very little politics
cons: systems could do with updating
advice: improve spreadsheets, automate systems

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: The company is a fantastic company to work for.  Most staff are excellent, friendly but you can get some trouble makers as in any industries. Pay was fair compared to other jobs and its not a difficult job to do. All Team leaders and managers were great. Basically you work by yourself and no one around to stress you out.
cons:
I found that most stores were not designed correctly to allow staff to work comfortably. Chairs, desks, equipment too old and caused problems all the time.
Stores need to be cleaned all the time and it was always a few staff members that would be constantly doing this. This is not the companies fault, this is the staff that are purely unwilling  to clean which in any other industries is unheard of.
advice: Keep your stores up to standard. Keep the staff that cares.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: Local, salary (was also a con), HR front line locally were extremely good and would have to be for the amount of redundancies and compromise agreements they have to get through...
cons: Management attitude to new management, very poor working conditions and way out of town,  not what you know, who you know regardless of seniority,  zero attitude to future, constant firefighting due to almost non existent investment in many areas.
advice: Stop empire building and build a company before you lose it, you are far to far away from market reality.
